properties.address: Brynmill Community Centre, Swansea, West Glamorgan SA2 0BP
properties.description: This warm hub offers a friendly and welcoming space to all. We meet every Thursday from 11.00am - 1pm and provide as much tea/coffee/squash and biscuits together with a bacon roll for a donation of just £2.00. Come along and meet new and old friends, local councillors and your local area coordinator.
properties.title: Brynmill Community Centre

properties.address: Pantygwydr Baptist Church, West Glamorgan SA2 0HN
properties.description: A wellbeing cafe for adults who feel isolated whether through health, loneliness or just needing company and social contact. We provide a quiet shared space where it's OK to not be OK. There are opportunities to come and share a hobby, learn a new one, enjoy the peace in our quiet area or chat and relax over a cup of tea or coffee. Optional prayer times are held for anyone who would like to join us. We are available Tuesdays between 2.00 pm and 4.00 pm

properties.address: Llanrhidian Primary School, Llanrhidian, Swansea, SA3 1EH
properties.description: Swansea Space We are open every term time Thursday, 9.00am - 11.45am. All welcome... At Caffi Cynefin, we're all about bringing people together to spread positivity, kindness, and a warm sense of belonging and offers our pupils exciting real-world work experiences. This Caffi is run by our wonderful pupils who are gaining experiences of the "real world of work". Come and join us! ; Caffi Cynefin is a place where all generations come together to relax, enjoy and reflect. We do not charge for our refreshments, but we will depend on donations to make this a sustainable and long term commitment. If you would like to volunteer or make any donations, please contact the school. Free wifi; Free charging points for phones or other devices; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets / accessible toilets / baby changing facilities; Car parking / disabled parking; Refreshments available; we serve tea, coffee, squash, a selection of cakes, crumpets, teacakes and have a weekly healthy option available (but most prefer the cakes). We do not charge!; 5 star food hygiene rating; Drinking water available;

properties.address: Christchurch, 244 Oystermouth Road, Swansea, SA1 3UH
properties.description: Entrance on Rodney Street. Youth club (school years 5-8) - Mondays, 4.30pm (see social media for dates), Craft group - Tuesdays, 1.30pm - 3.30pm, Baby and Toddler group - Every other Wednesday from 12 February, 10.00am - 12.00pm, Community Cafe - Thursdays, 10.00am - 12.00pm; Swansea Veterans Hub Open every Saturday 10.00am - 12.00pm, Tuesday 10.00am - 1.00pm and offer free warm food to people needing support in the community as well as Veterans and their families. We offer support for financial difficulties (including PIP and DWP issues), employment, housing, health and wellbeing issues and the cost-of-living crisis, food and fuel poverty. Our volunteers are all DBS-checked, fully trained in mental health, first aid and safeguarding. ; We are incredibly fortunate to have 24/7 access to our Jack's Retreat, where veterans and their families or those who are serving/reservists can access wild camping, woodland walks, bush crafting, stargazing and other family orientated activities. SVH fully embrace and are signed up to the Armed Forces Covenant to help ensure that those who serve or have served in the armed forces and their families are all treated fairly. We are one of the few places in Swansea to offer face-to-face interactions for both veterans and their families. Refreshments available; free tea and coffee available, breakfast on Saturdays; Advice, information and signposting; the hub operates in partnership with several local organisations to provide mental health and wellbeing support and signposting for veterans, their families and safe, warm space attendees. , 07894417590, www.swanseaveteranshub.org.uk ;

properties.address: Ernald Place, Uplands, Swansea, SA2 0HN
properties.description: Swansea Space ; Free period products ; Swansea Space - Renew at The Stream Tuesdays 2.00pm - 4.00pm; We all have days when we're feeling fed up - problems on our mind, parent, carer, just want some company? Renew@ The Stream offers a warm, safe space of welcome and inclusion aimed at improving emotional wellbeing. Share hobbies and activities, learn something new, make new friends or just take time out with a cup of tea or coffee. Use our quiet space for personal reflection or join us in an optional short time meditating on a Psalm. Free wifi; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets / accessible toilets / baby changing facilities; Games / board games; Refreshments available; free tea, coffee, squash and biscuits and cakes available, pay what you can afford. Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Newspapers / magazines; Advice, information and signposting; we base our space around the NHS 5 ways to wellbeing (connect, be active, take notice, keep learning, give) and can work in partnership with local area coordinators, mental health services and third sector bodies to signpost to sources of help. Free period products

properties.description: Every Friday, 3.00pm - 8.00pm; Warm space with comfortable seating, free WiFi, and a selection of reading journals is available. Participants also have access to a kitchen for making tea and occasional refreshments, depending on attendance. We offer weekly activities tailored to the 50+ club, with separate sessions for women and men - details on the mosque's website. Every Friday afternoon, we provide a hot meal for dinner followed by a lecture featuring a local resident's journey to Swansea and their experiences. A lunch will be provided with options such as soup and rolls, bacon rolls, burgers, beans, jacket potatoes, etc. Drinking water available; Service provision will include drop-in support from the Homelessness and Mental Health nurses based at the St Helens Medical Centre; housing support for those receiving current housing support from Citadel, Housing Justice charity; and a monthly music therapy session, provided by an undergraduate music therapist. We will work in partnership with the local area coordinators in Swansea.

Free wifi; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets / accessible toilets / baby changing facilities; Car parking; Outdoor space; Advice, information and signposting; our friendly and helpful staff will do our best to answer any questions you have about our collection and the local area - whether historical or just for directions; Free entry to exhibitions as well as free events and activities;

properties.address: Linden Avenue, West Cross, Swansea, SA3 5LE
properties.description: Mumbles Community Council The Warm Hub (Friday Teatime with Friends), open 4.30pm - 7.00pm on first and third Fridays of the month. Additionally, a Community Quiz is held (free entry) on the third Friday of the month from 7.30pm until 10.00pm. The community centre is open to provide a warm welcome, hot soup and rolls and drinks and refreshments. There are friendly people for a chat, kids toys for little ones and access to wifi for those who need to get work or homework done. There will be activities running some weeks such as crafts, board games and more. On the third Friday of the month we open into the evening for a Community Quiz - all welcome, no charge!; Toys for children; Games / board games; Refreshments available; all refreshments free of charge - hot drinks and snacks; Drinking water available; Advice, information and signposting; city councillors and community councillors attend and can offer support with addressing local issues. We can also connect people to the right port of call. Contact (Swansea Space): Email: / Tel: 07724 437 865;
